title: ‘Widespread practice’: Man wrongly convicted of Roxbury murder says detectives framed him
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News The federal lawsuit points to a “widespread practice” of officers who forced false identifications from witnesses and routinely buried evidence ahead of trials.
A portrait of Milton Jones.
Louis D.

title: Where to find food assistance around Boston
author: Frances Klemm and Annie Jonas
bullets: Local News Here's a list of food resources in the Boston area.
The produce section of Nubian Markets in Boston.
(Pat Greenhouse/ The Boston Globe Staff) More than a million people in Massachusetts could lose access to federal food assistance starting Nov.

title: ‘Highly sensitive’ data found on ex-Trooper Michael Proctor’s phone, prosecutors say
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News One text chain from the device allegedly included “images of intimate body parts” and the name of a sexual assault victim, among other data.
Former Massachusetts State Police Trooper Michael Proctor testifies during Karen Read's first trial, Wednesday, June 12, 2024, in Norfolk Superior Court in Dedham, Mass.
Greg Derr / The Patriot Ledger via AP, Pool By Abby Patkin October 27, 2025 | 4:20 PM 2 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: 3 maps showing Hurricane Melissa’s track, timing, wind speeds, and rainfall
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Weather "Catastrophic winds in the eyewall have the potential to cause total structural failure especially in higher elevation areas tonight and early Tuesday," the National Hurricane Center said Monday regarding Jamaica.

title: The Springsteen movie is a dud. Watch these music biopics instead.

title: People have gotten stuck on Canobie Lake Park rides twice in just over a week
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Local News The passengers on one of the rides were rescued by the Salem Fire Department.
Entrance to Canobie Lake park in Salem, NH.
Handout Riders have gotten stuck on rides at Canobie Lake Park twice in just over a week.

title: Harvard Dental School shutting down Cambridge clinic permanently
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News The school says the move will consolidate care and training at its Longwood campus.
Dental students work on a clinic patient at the The Teaching Practices of the Harvard Dental Center, Boston.
Alissa Ambrose / STAT The Harvard School of Dental Medicine announced last week that it is permanently closing its Cambridge clinic, citing an electrical fire and ongoing financial challenges.

title: Boston city councilor’s plan to hike taxes on luxury apartment buildings sparks developer backlash
author: Cameron Sperance
bullets: Real Estate News Councilor Brian Worrell released a plan that calls for raising the tax rate on large and/or luxury apartment buildings and lower tax bills for the “average” Boston homeowner and small landlord.
The St.
Regis Residences, right, are luxury housing in the Seaport.

title: Report of shots fired prompts shelter-in-place at college near Boston
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Local News No injuries were reported.
Frank O'Brien / The Boston Globe, File ShareSend this article to your social connections.
Curry College in Milton was put under a shelter-in-place after shots were fired on Saturday.
